title: What is the meaning behind BTS’ new song ‘Idol’? - Quora

response.answer_text: I've been seeing some ARMYs saying Idol is just another diss track or Mic Drop Pt2. Well it's not. Idol isn't a diss track but a song with the message of loving yourself. Diss track is only meant for their haters but this song is about every single person including their fans who keep judging them for their every little action on everyday basis. In the video,Namjoon and Taehyung did exactly opposite to their fans' liking. ARMYs and BTS have a close bond but that doesn't mean they can't do something that fans wouldn't want them to. After all, they are people. They too have their likes and dislikes and yes they've always put ARMYs choices before theirs but that doesn't mean they can't put themselves first sometimes. So the first step of loving yourself is putting yourself first in your priority list. Next, in Jungkook's small rap, he say how there are 100s of different versions of himself. However, he can only show a single version of himself in front of the camera so as not to be judged by people. This is what idols' lives are. They can't eat as much as they want to, they can't take a break whenever they want to, they can't date. It's like their feelings are manipulated as well. They can't be humans and if they make a single mistake, that is going to haunt them for weeks. Just like every other idol, Jungkook too is unable to show his true self to the people with the fear of being criticised. With this point, they're talking about the fact that people should stop trying to fit in someone's else's shoes and start embracing their true selves. That's the next step of loving yourself. When BTS debuted, they had no idea how much success they'll achieve. They constantly tried to please the few fans they had. Jimin was bashed for his weight, Jungkook for his acne, Namjoon for his looks. Criticism is what they always had on their plates. But in those days, they took them seriously and that affected them in many ways. Jimin went through a strict diet that had a bad effect on his health, Jungkook kept himself from social media because of these stuffs and so on. Now, they're more successful than any musical band from their country could ever be. However, with fame came hate. People started criticising them for their changed behavior, controversies regarding a t-shirt, accusations of becoming too westernized and forgetting their roots. They've realized no matter how hard you try, you can't run away from critisims, neither can your success shut them down. So why bother? People shouldn't bother about situations they can't change. Instead, they should bring changes where they can. Just like that every person in the society is criticised for one thing or another. However people shouldn't be affected by them and instead be themselves and be happy about yourself. That's how you can find mental peace. Lastly, just like they said “ you can't stop me loving myself”, everyone should learn to love themselves despite all the hate and criticism they receive because that way we can truly lead a happy life. Be the master of your own world and don't let negativities affect you. Now, that way my interpretation of the song. Hope this helped.
